Execution of known compiler binaries (cs.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation. Filter for known compiler process names (csc.exe, ilasm.exe, gcc, etc.). Analyze the parent process and command-line arguments for suspicious patterns (e.g., execution from temporary directories, unusual arguments). Use frequency analysis to identify rare parent-child process relationships involving compilers or count executions per user/host to find anomalies.

Creation or modification of executable f.Data: Windows Event ID 4663, Windows Event ID 4688
Creation or modification of executable f.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 for file modification events and Windows Event ID 4688 for new process creation paths. Identify newly created or modified executable files (.exe, .dll) in temporary or user-writable directories. Correlate file creation/modification events with recent compiler process executions (identified via Event ID 4688) within a short time window. Use time series analysis to identify surges in file modification events or executable creations tied to specific process executions.
